alert.note: Alert for Erie (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 21 at 8:33PM EDT until May 22 at 12:30AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cleveland has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Erie County in northwestern Pennsylvania... * Until 1230 AM EDT. * At 833 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Corry, Union City and Elgin. At 820 PM EDT, law enforcement reported basement flooding and road closures in Union City. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
